alert.note: Alert for Houston; Northern Liberty; Polk; San Jacinto; Trinity (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 23 at 3:22AM CDT until August 23 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 108. For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures from 104 to 106 and heat index values up to 113 expected. * WHERE...Houston, Trinity, San Jacinto, Polk and Northern Liberty Counties. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until noon CDT today. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from noon today to 10 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
